ClassDesc: Source of encoded image data. References the data that will be used to decode a @B_android#graphics#drawable#Drawable_E@ or @B_android#graphics#Bitmap_E@ in @B_android#graphics#ImageDecoder#decodeDrawable_E@ or @B_android#graphics#ImageDecoder#decodeBitmap_E@. Constructing a Source (with one of the overloads of createSource) can be done on any thread because the construction simply captures values. The real work is done in @B_android#graphics#ImageDecoder#decodeDrawable_E@ or @B_android#graphics#ImageDecoder#decodeBitmap_E@. A Source object can be reused to create multiple versions of the same image. For example, to decode a full size image and its thumbnail, the same Source can be used once with no @B_android#graphics#ImageDecoder#OnHeaderDecodedListener_E@ and once with an implementation of @B_android#graphics#ImageDecoder#OnHeaderDecodedListener#onHeaderDecoded_E@ that calls @B_android#graphics#ImageDecoder#setTargetSize_E@ with smaller dimensions. One Source can even be used simultaneously in multiple threads.
